title: 107_hr3676
content: The Act titled "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" amends the Social Security Act to include coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under the Medicare program. This includes defining counseling for cessation of tobacco use as a covered service. The Act "Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001" amends the Social Security Act to include coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under the Medicare program. Counseling for cessation of tobacco use is defined as diagnostic, therapy, and counseling services for individuals using tobacco products, provided by authorized healthcare professionals following clinical practice guidelines. The Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001 amends the Social Security Act to provide coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under Medicare. This includes eliminating coinsurance and deductibles for counseling services related to tobacco cessation. The Medicare, Medicaid, and MCH Tobacco Use Cessation Promotion Act of 2001 provides coverage for counseling for tobacco cessation under Medicare, including eliminating coinsurance and deductibles for these services. Amendments made by this act apply to services furnished on or after January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the date of enactment. SEC. 3. Coverage of counseling for cessation of tobacco use under the Medicaid program. The amendment to the Social Security Act includes dropping exceptions for Medicaid coverage of tobacco cessation medications and requiring coverage of counseling for pregnant women. Cost-sharing for tobacco cessation counseling services for pregnant women is also removed. The Social Security Act is amended to include coverage of counseling for tobacco cessation for pregnant women. The effective date for these amendments is January 1 of the first calendar year that begins at least 6 months after the enactment of the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include counseling for tobacco cessation as part of maternal and child health services. This amendment will take effect upon the enactment of the Act.
